titlestmt.titleproper: BU Records: Recreational Sports Department, Inclusive: 1996-1997

note.p: Â© 2021 The Texas Collection. All rights reserved.

profiledesc.creation: Finding Aid was generated by The Texas Collection staff, using the STAR Knowledge Center for Archives (SKCA) task that automatically creates EAD files from the Archive's SKCA catalog records.

did.head: Records Summary
did.abstract: BU Records: Recreational Sports Department contains the 1996-97 Year End Report produced by the department.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: Baylor University's Recreational Sports Department, now known as Campus Recreation, engages students and the Baylor community in experiential learning, recreational and leisure activities that equip individuals to live balanced, holistic and healthy lifestyles. The vision of the Intramural Sports Program at Baylor University is to provide students with a variety of recreational opportunities that allow them to become engaged in healthy competition while developing and maintaining character, integrity, respect, social skills, and sportsmanship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The collection begins in 1996 and ends in 1997. There is one, unbound report detailing the activities of the department for the 1996-1997 academic year, including financial analysis, participation statistics for various intramural sports, and space activity reports for buildings and gyms relating to campus recreation.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Prior to current processing, the collection was arranged in one bound report. Currently, the report is unbound and housed in one folder in one series: I. Reports. Within the folder, materials were kept in their original order.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: All requests for copying of materials must be submitted to The Texas Collection in writing. Please use the Request Form for Copying Materials sheet. Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator (s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

userestrict.head: Use/Re-use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: BU Records: Recreational Sports Department, Accession #BU/344, Box #, Folder #, The Texas Collection, Baylor University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Described by Leanna Barcelona. Released on 2020-03-24.

bioghist.head: Biography/Profile
bioghist.p: This series contains one report from the department. This series is in excellent condition.
